Provide evidence that this account is registered with an accredited Client Money Protection Scheme provider as required under the Client Money Protection Schemes for Property Agents (Approval and Designation of Schemes) Regulations 2018
Provide details of an equivalent trust deed which nominates your chosen account and legally requires that any funds provided to that account are held for the benefit of leaseholders ('a Trust Fund')

questions.helpText: This will be required before we are able to make grant payments into that account

question.text: Does the Applicant have a Client Money Account, registered with an accredited Client Money Protection Scheme provider, into which we can make grant payments?

questions.helpText:
The applicant should provide details of Client Money Account or Trust Fund into which the GLA will make grant payments.
If applicants are utilising a Client Money Account they are required to provide evidence that this account is registered under the Client Money Protection Scheme (CMPS), Client Money Protection Schemes for Property Agents (Approval and Designation of Schemes) Regulations 2018. This regime includes CM Protect, UKALA, Safeagent (previously National Approved Letting Scheme (NALS)), ARLA Propertymark and Money Shield.

question.text: Upload a copy of the proposed deed so that this can be verified ([Template deed available here](https://www.london.gov.uk/file/50732201))

questions.helpText: This must certify that the funds are held for the benefit of leaseholders and detail a legally binding trust arrangement with them for this purpose

question.text: Are you ready to enter information about leaseholders that are Undertakings and/or properties in the building that are used for social housing?

Secure from all Undertakings as listed in the Undertakings Summary Schedule a completed and signed State Aid Declaration. Scan and merge these into a single PDF document (or a few if you have collected them in batches)

questions.helpText: An Undertaking is any leaseholder who uses their property for financial gain whether residential or commercial

question.text: How many units?
Confirm that all properties owned and let by the social housing provider(s) are either let at sub-market rents or on shared ownership terms

questions.helpText: Where any property is let by the social housing provider either: (a)  at a market rent or (b) on a long lease granted on market terms or on a shared ownership lease that has staircased to 100% these will not be capable of inclusion within any SGEI Agreement executed by the Registered Provider and any Residential Undertakings should be declared

question.text: Provide contact details for social housing provider(s)
Are there any properties in the block that are used for any tenure of social housing, including shared ownership and affordable rent?
Provide name(s) of the social housing provider(s)
Upload your completed [Undertaking Summary Schedule](https://www.london.gov.uk/file/50732108)

question.text: Add any additional information you need to make us aware of or queries about Project team appointments
Confirm that you hold formal written evidence, available on request, that Planning approval is not required
Explain your tender strategy

Confirm that the lead designer agrees that any Contractor’s Design Portion elements are suitable and sufficient in order to complete the design development in accordance with the Fund requirements, and that evidence of this is available on request
Explain why that is the case and specify when confirmation can be provided in the free text box below
Confirm your tender strategy

questions.helpText:
Obtaining Quotes / Open tender: quotations and proposals are sought from numerous contractors. 
Negotiate: a single contractor is approached to conduct the Works and costs are negotiated.

question.text: Confirm your procurement strategy

questions.helpText:
Traditional: contractors tender on the basis of a fully designed project. 
Design & Build: contractors tender based on partially complete design information on the basis the appointed contractor will have the responsibility for completing the design.

question.text: Add any additional information you need to make us aware of, or queries about statutory approvals

Explain your procurement strategy
Add any additional information you need to make us aware of, or queries about contract execution
Enter the total project cost from your Full Works and Costs spreadsheet (£)

Confirm that a ‘competent professional’ agrees and has signed off that the split of costs between eligible and ineligible costs are accurate and that the breakdown is accurate and the totals are correct, and evidence of this is available on request

questions.helpText: This confirmation may take the form of a tender report or tender recommendation

question.text: Are you able to provide details at this stage of the full works and costs?

Confirm that a ‘competent professional’ has certified that the planned remediation design and Works comply with the Building Safety Fund’s requirements, and that you have on file formal written evidence of this, that is available on request

questions.helpText:
Guidance regarding what constitutes a ‘competent professional’ can be found within the BSF Fund Application Guidance.  
Certification may take the form of a design report or technical note certifying that the design meets the requirements

question.text: Confirm that Full Plans Approval or a Plans Certificate will be in place prior to start on site, or (where a Design and Build contract will be used) that Full Plans Approval or a Plans Certificate will be in place at completion of RIBA Stage 4

questions.helpText: RIBA stands for Royal Institute of British Architects

question.text: Explain why that is the case and specify when confirmation can be provided in the free text box below

questions.helpText: Guidance regarding appropriate professional indemnity insurance levels should be sought from a Competent Professional if required and held on file when followed

question.text: Applicants are required to hold and maintain a Project Directory of existing and proposed professional team appointments. Confirm you have such a directory and that it is available on request
Confirm that residents and leaseholders will be informed of the proposed Start on Site Date at least two weeks prior to such date

Confirm that appropriate levels of Professional Indemnity Insurance and limits of liability, for the risk associated and in accordance with industry best practice, are in place for all current appointments and evidence of this is available on request

questions.helpText:
Applicants are required to keep evidence of Professional Indemnity Insurance for all existing and proposed professional team and contractor appointments and information on any limits of liability. 
Guidance regarding appropriate professional indemnity insurance levels should be sought from a Competent Professional if required and held on file when followed.

question.text: Enter the value of total eligible costs from your Full Works and Costs spreadsheet (£)

Confirm that a  ‘competent professional’ agrees that the contract sum represents a reasonable sum for the Works cost given current market conditions, taking into account any qualifications or exclusions, and that evidence of this is available on request

questions.helpText: Contract sum: total Works cost split between ineligible and eligible costs.  Confirmation may take the form of a tender report or tender recommendation

question.text: Confirm you have appointment documentation for all appointments made to date, and that these are available on request

questions.helpText: Applicants are required to keep all existing appointment documentation (including scope of service, fee and the Applicant’s acceptance) for all professional team appointments

question.text: Confirm if the Works Contract will require any design to be carried out by the contractor (Contractor’s Design Portion)

Confirm sign off of the Specification or Employer's Requirements detailing the full project Works has been provided by a 'competent professional' and that evidence of specification sign-off and records in accordance with the above are available on request

questions.helpText: Applicants must have a ‘competent professional’ sign off the Specification or Employer's Requirements detailing the full project Works (details of the BS EN 13501 classification of the replacement cladding material, insulation and sheathing board, where applicable, should be recorded and the BS EN 13501 classification of any of these materials which are being retained regardless of quantity)

question.text: Do the Works require Planning approval?
Confirm that planning approval will be in place prior to start on site
Confirm that you have Full Plans Approval or a Plans Certificate (available on request)

Confirm that you have on file formal written evidence of competence for all professional project team appointments, signed off by the Applicant or appointed 'competent professional', and that this is available on request

questions.helpText: Applicants are required to keep evidence of competence for all professional project team appointments (evidence of membership to professional bodies and record of project experience etc.)

question.text: Add any additional information you need to make us aware of, or queries about Procurement

questions.helpText: This confirmation may take the form of a tender report or tender recommendation

questions.helpText: Guidance regarding appropriate professional indemnity insurance levels should be sought from a Competent Professional if required and held on file when followed

Confirm all remaining Statutory Approvals will be in place within the timescales required by the authorities providing the approvals

questions.helpText: Other statutory approvals required may include highways, network rail, utilities providers etc

question.text: Confirm a ‘competent professional’ has agreed the existing and proposed scoping documentation covers the full scope of Works and there are no scope or coordination gaps, and that you have on file formal written evidence of this (available on request)

questions.helpText:
This confirmation may take the form of a competent professional signing off all scoping documentation as having been reviewed and is fully coordinated.
Guidance regarding what constitutes a ‘competent professional’ can be found within the BSF Fund Application Guidance.
Certification may take the form of a design report or technical note certifying that the design meets the requirements

questions.helpText: As part of the funding agreement, the Applicant is expected to provide notice of any cost variations within a reasonable timescale. Dependent on the contract type and the variation it may not be possible to provide finalised estimates of cost and time resulting from the variation. As such, the Applicant is requested to provide estimates in support of any variation requests, with final time and cost contract agreements to be uploaded as soon as practicably possible
